instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .

threads.title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
threads.message: I have Macbook Air 11, Early 2014 that works just fine without anyproblemes but the issue is with the charger light. It doesnt light up at all..

threads.title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
threads.message: No comunication with One wire circuit  I guess , inspect Magsafe board for corrosion and or flat cable or connectors....

threads.title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
threads.message: But why does it start normally if there is no communication with the one wire circuit?

threads.title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
threads.message: Because you have a charged battery

threads.title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
threads.message: No i don't. Theres no even battery attached to computer.

threads.title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
threads.message:
Have you tried alternate DC in board/dc in board flex?

The onewire circuit is on the DC in board on this model.

99% of the time it is bad flex cable,corrosion on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> pins of the dc in connector. 

1% of the time it is the SMC.

threads.title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
threads.message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 889"]Have you tried alternate DC in board/dc in board flex?

The onewire circuit is on the DC in board on this model.

99% of the time it is bad flex cable,corrosion on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> pins of the dc in connector.

1% of the time it is the SMC. [/QUOTE]

Totally agree! Had the same issue and fixed it by replacing the flex cable! The old one had burned pins.

threads.title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
threads.message: Found out what caused the problem. Seems like there is 98 prosent chance that the flex cable is bad or the dc in board. Or 1 prosent the SMC. Found out that the last prosent was corrosion on the motherboards flex cables pins and did not connect in one pins. Solderd the pin back where it belong and now it works like a charm without any issues. Thanks everybody! :)

threads.title: [solved]Macbook Air 11, early 2014 green light problem
threads.message: You can also fix the DC in board. Look at <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> on any unibody, then look at the dc in board. In some cases when I didn't have a dc in flex for an older air and a customer was an impatient fuck I would run all the wires from the mainboard using magnet wire to the dc in board to freshly soldered onewire circuitry... fun times. :-)
